snippet: James H. Ammons stepped down as the parents of Robert Champion, a band drum major, asserted in their suit that university officials had not done enough to end hazing.
abstract: James H Ammons resigns as president of Florida A&M University eight months after the hazing death of Robert Champion, a member of the school's celebrated marching band; resignation comes on the same day that Champion's parents file suit against the university, charging that administrators failed to do enough to curb hazing.
lead_paragraph: James H. Ammons stepped down as the parents of Robert Champion, a band drum major, asserted in their suit that university officials had not done enough to end hazing.

headline.main: President of Florida A&M Resigns as Parents of Hazing Victim File Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: President of Florida A&M Steps Down as Parents of Hazing Victim File Lawsuit
